cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SSW of Great Exuma Island, and about 370 mi ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW, forecast to skirt along or just north of Cuba today, reach the Florida Keys Saturday, then track north-northwest toward the eastern Gulf and Florida’s west coast/Big Bend Sunday–Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend or eastern Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ciego de Ávila to Granma (Cuba) and southwest Florida coast from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and central Cuba, the Bahamas, Florida Keys, and Florida west coast northward to the Big Bend area
weather_observation.wind: None – only distant peripheral breezes expected
weather_observation.rainfall: None expected; heaviest rain now focused over Cuba, Bahamas, and south Florida
